description: From Latin recrīminātus, past participle of recrīminō.

verbs.description: recriminate (third-person singular simple present recriminates, present participle recriminating, simple past and past participle recriminated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To accuse in return, state an accusation in return, make a countercharge.
examples: Tom said Harry had lied, and Harry recriminated by saying Tom had manipulated him.
